title: About
text: My name is Cameron King I’m a Sports Media Communications and Advertising & Public Relations major at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. I want to be a NBA Draft Analyst and eventually a scout for a NBA team in the future.

title: Welcome To My Blog
text:

title: Does Taking More Threes Lead To More Wins In The NBA
text:
Lede
Opening
assertion
lead into graph


Code
library(tidyverse)


── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.4.4     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.3     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──

✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()

Code
library(ggrepel)
library(patchwork)


Warning: package 'patchwork' was built under R version 4.3.3




Code
Threepluswin <- read_csv("threepluswin24.csv")


Rows: 90 Columns: 26
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (1): Team
dbl (25): Rk, G, MP, FG, FGA, FG%, 3P, 3PA, 3P%, 2P, 2PA, 2P%, FT, FTA, FT%,...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.


Code
TPW <- Threepluswin |>
select(Team, `3P`,`3PA`,`3P%`,Wins)

CTPW24 <- TPW |>
filter(Team == "Bos Celtics24")

NTPW23 <- TPW |>
filter(Team == "Den Nuggets23")

WTPW22 <- TPW |>
filter(Team == "GS Warriors22")

ggplot() + 
  geom_point(
    data=TPW, 
    aes(x=`3PA`, y=`3P`, size=Wins), 
    color="grey", 
    alpha=.5) + 
  geom_point(
    data=CTPW24, 
    aes(x=`3PA`, y=`3P`, size=Wins), 
    color="gold") + 
  geom_text_repel(
    data=CTPW24, 
    aes(x=`3PA`, y=`3P`, label=Team) )+
  geom_point(
    data=NTPW23, 
    aes(x=`3PA`, y=`3P`, size=Wins), 
    color="gold")+ 
  geom_text_repel(
    data=NTPW23, 
    aes(x=`3PA`, y=`3P`, label=Team) )+    
       geom_point(
    data=WTPW22, 
    aes(x=`3PA`, y=`3P`, size=Wins), 
    color="gold") + 
  geom_text_repel(
    data=WTPW22, 
    aes(x=`3PA`, y=`3P`, label=Team))+
  geom_vline(xintercept = 34.83) + 
  geom_hline(yintercept = 12.5)+
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(9,18 ))+
 geom_text(aes(x=34.83, label="League Average 3's Taken", y=14.5, label="League Average 3's Made"), color="black") +
geom_text(aes(x=40.5, y=18, label="More 3's Taken, More 3's Made"), color="black") +
geom_text(aes(x=31.5, y=9, label="Less 3's Take, Less 3's Made"), color="black") +
  labs(
    x="Three Point Attempts Per Game", 
    y="Three Point Makes Per Game", 
    title="The best teams take and make more threes", 
    subtitle="Two of the last three champions have taken and made a lot more threes than the avearge team the past three years", 
    caption="By: Cameron King  |  Source: basketball-reference.com ") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    )


Warning: Duplicated aesthetics after name standardisation: label
Duplicated aesthetics after name standardisation: label

Code
library(tidyverse)
library(ggrepel)
library(patchwork)

LAVG <- read_csv("leagueavg.csv")


Rows: 11 Columns: 25
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (1): LA
dbl (24): Year, G, MP, FG, FGA, FG%, 3P, 3PA, 3P%, 2P, 2PA, 2P%, FT, FTA, FT...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.


Code
LAVG3 <- LAVG |>
select(Year, `3P`,`3PA`,`3P%`)

Y25 <- LAVG |> 
  filter(Year == "2025")

bar1 <- ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=LAVG3, aes(x=reorder(Year, `3PA`), weight=`3PA`))  +
  geom_bar(data=Y25, aes(x=reorder(Year, `3PA`), weight=`3PA`), fill="gold") +
  coord_flip()+
   labs(title="The NBA is valuing volume over percentage", 
       subtitle = "Teams accross the NBA are taking and making more threes than ever",  
       x="", y="NBA average 3-pointers shot per game", 
       caption = "") + 
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 18, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 9), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=13), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    )


bar2 <- ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=LAVG3, aes(x=reorder(Year, `3P`), weight=`3P`))  +
  geom_bar(data=Y25, aes(x=reorder(Year, `3P`), weight=`3P`), fill="gold") +
  coord_flip()+
  labs(title = "", 
       subtitle= "", 
       x="", y="NBA average 3-pointers made per game",  
       caption="") + 
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 18, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 9), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=13), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    )


bar3 <- ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=LAVG3, aes(x=reorder(Year, `3P%`), weight=`3P%`))  +
  geom_bar(data=Y25, aes(x=reorder(Year, `3P%`), weight=`3P%`), fill="gold") +
  coord_flip()+ 
   labs(title = "", 
       subtitle= "", 
       x="", y="NBA average 3-point percentage",  
       caption="By: Cameron King  |  Source: basketball-reference.com ") +
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 18, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 9), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=13), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    )
bar1 + bar2 + bar3
